Summary: Constant red light with wildly random white strobe.
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Hot Springs
There were no other sightings in Hot Springs on or around November 23rd 2008
divs: Sighting DetailsI was standing on the back porch at my house which is near Mt. Pine junction, looking at the sky in the direction of the local airport, when I saw an unusually bright red light moving to the left of my view at a fairly slow speed. Shortly after I spotted the light, it began flashing a high intensity strobe light which was white in a random pattern which was very rapid sometimes (4-5 flashes per second) and slower at other times (2-3 seconds between each flash). At first I thought that I must be seeing some type of helicopter because of the slow speed and low altitude, and the white strobes must be the flash from a camera. But a helicopter would more than likely have more than just one red light right? And why would anyone be using a flash on a camera while in the air at night? I would think the light wouldn't be reflected enough unless you were rather close to the subject you were taking a picture of? Anyway, the whole thing only lasted about 45 seconds and then it was being blocked by trees and I lost sight of it.
